Authors: Pane M.M., Lake S.C.J.M., Patriana R.
Title: Teamwork competency mapping of ubinus student toward the ASEAN economic community
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KemanggisanIlir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pane, M.M., Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KemanggisanIlir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia; Lake, S.C.J.M., Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KemanggisanIlir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia; Patriana, R., Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KemanggisanIlir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to map the extent of teamwork ability of Bina Nusantara University students to face the era of the ASEAN Economic Community (AEC). Respondents selected studies were Binusian 2017 (5th semester student). Respondents amounted to 482 people from five departments: Psychology, Computer Science, Management, Accounting, and Marketing Communication. The research results are processed using SPSS. The normality test showed P <0_05, participants’ mean score 87.78 and standard deviation 13,075. The results showed that 362 respondents (75.1%) have the ability to teamwork in moderate level, 68 (14.11%) in the high level, and 52 (10.79%) in the lower level. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Aronson, E., Timothy, D.W., Robin, M.A., (2013) Social Psychology, , 8th edn; (2009) Roadmap for an ASEAN Community 2009-2015: One Vision, One Identity, One Community, , ASEAN Secretariat, Jakarta; Budijanto, R.R., (2013) Thinking Styles, Teamwork Quality and Performance, , www.canberra.au, (The Thesis for the degree of Doctor of Philosophy), University of Canberra, Canberra, accessed on August 2015; Evienia, Pandangan Pelaku Pendidikan Di Universitas Terhadap Pemberlakuan Masyarakat Ekonomi ASEAN 2015, , http://journal.unpar.ac.id/index.php/BinaEkonomi/article/view/1190, Universitas Katolik Parahyangan, Bandung, accessed on January 2016 (2014); Man, J., (2014) Design Teamwork in Distributed Intercultural Teams: Competition, Collaboration, , Cooperation (Thesis), Technische Universiteit Eindhoven, Eindhoven; Shiraev, E.B., David, A.L., (2014) Cross Cultural Psychology, , Pearson New International Edition, Essex; (2012) Industrial and Organizational Psychology: Research and Practice, , 6th edn., John Wiley and Sons, Singapore
Correspondence Address: Pane, M.M.; Character Building Development Center, Jl. KemanggisanIlir III No. 45, Indonesia

Authors: Yunus U., Sari S.A., Patriana R.C.
Title: Excellent communication in indonesian government culture to reach good public governance
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Department of Marketing Communication, Faculty of Economic and Communication, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Education for Elementary School, Faculty of Humanities, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yunus, U., Department of Marketing Communication, Faculty of Economic and Communication, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sari, S.A., School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Patriana, R.C., Department of Education for Elementary School, Faculty of Humanities, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this research is to identify concepts of organisational communication using qualitative methodology through interviews with local government leaders on the role of communication in Indonesian government culture in achieving good public governance. The findings show: 1) the position of leaders as the most important component of communication 2) GPG could be disseminated to members if the organisation's culture has the following features: Process Oriented, Professional Approach, Open situation, Formal Relations, and Fix Regulation. 3) Excellent communication occurs when there is trust in sources and receiver to communicate, and create value for both sides. This study concludes that excellent organisation communication which supports GPG is able to maintain continuity of communication in an organisation. Excellent communication for GPG is communication that serves the community's interests.
Author Keywords: Communication; Excellent; Good Public Governance; Organisation Culture
References: Arguden, Y., (2010) A Corporate Governance Model: Building Responsible Boards and Sustainable Businesses.
